poem:
**Resonance**

A landslide, ice's whisper,
Greenland shook the globe,
a nine-day tremor—
not terror, but a shiver
beneath our feet. 

Climate's pulse 
in seismic songs,
the Earth sang a hymn
of fragility.
We danced un-knowing,
to the beat
of nature clashing
with our hand.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Entire Earth vibrated for nine days after climate-triggered mega-tsunami A landslide and mega-tsunami in Greenland in September 2023, triggered by the climate crisis, caused the entire Earth to vibrate for nine days, a scientific investigation has found. The seismic event was detected by earthquake sensors around the world but was so completely unprecedented that the researchers initially had no idea what had caused it. Having now solved the mystery, the scientists said it showed how". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Entire Earth vibrated for nine days after climate-triggered mega-tsunami A landslide and mega-tsunami in Greenland in September 2023, triggered by the climate crisis, caused the entire Earth to vibrate for nine days, a scientific investigation has found. The seismic event was detected by earthquake sensors around the world but was so completely unprecedented that the researchers initially had no idea what had caused it. Having now solved the mystery, the scientists said it showed how
